title: Trade Mark Sign

verbs: To register something as a trademark.
Secure a copyright on a written work
To obtain or secure a copyright for some literary or other artistic work.
nouns: A trademark, trade mark, or trade-mark is a recognizable sign, design or expression which identifies products or services of a particular source from those of others.
A formally registered symbol identifying the manufacturer or distributor of a product
A word or mark that distinctly indicates the ownership of a product or service, and that is legally reserved for the exclusive use of that owner.
A word, symbol, or phrase used to identify a particular company's product and differentiate it from other companies' products.

A word, phrase, symbol, or design (or some combination thereof) used to identify a proprietary product and claimed but not registered with a governmental body. It is often accompanied by the symbol TM.
Recognizable sign, design or expression which identifies products or services
A word, phrase, symbol, or design (or some combination thereof) used to identify a proprietary product and registered with a governmental body. It is often accompanied by the symbol ®.
A treaty involved in intellectual property identification

description: A trademark symbol, the letters TM displayed after a word that is trademarked.
apple_vendor_description: The trade-mark emoji on Apple devices is a crisp, bold capital 'TM' enclosed within a perfectly circular, soft blue outline. Apple’s signature clean design is evident in the sharp definition of the letters and the smooth, unblemished gradient of the circle, which offers a subtle 3D effect. This emoji, with its professional and distinctive appearance, is commonly used to denote proprietary brands, intellectual property, and the official recognition of a company or product name, signifying authenticity and established identity.
